[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]

Mentor, I'm feeling really lonely in this new city. I don't know anyone yet and I miss my old friends.
I understand that starting over can be tough, Mentee. But remember, this is also an opportunity for you to meet new people and make new connections.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'College application stress', 'Related Summaries': 'Mentee shares feeling overwhelmed with the college application process, and Mentor provides reassurance and study tips.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Mentee: Mentor, I'm feeling really overwhelmed with the college application process. But remember, you're not alone in this. Many students are feeling the same way. ### Mentee: I know, but it feels like everyone else has everything together. They have their applications submitted and their essays already written. ### Mentor: Don't compare yourself to others, Mentee. Everyone works at their own pace. What matters is that you're putting in the effort and taking the steps necessary to reach your goals. ### Mentee: That's true. But I feel like I'm running out of time. The SAT is next month and I don't feel ready. ### Mentor: Have you been studying consistently? ### Mentee: Yes, but it feels like there's so much material to cover. ### Mentor: Remember to break it down into manageable chunks. Schedule study sessions and breaks to prevent burnout. And don't forget to utilize resources like practice exams and review books. ### Mentee: Thanks, Mentor. I appreciate your advice. ### Mentor: Of course, Mentee. And always remember to take care of yourself. A healthy mind and body will help you tackle any challenge that comes your way.' }
```
